Package nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class is the core of handling the game's logic. Its main field is the maze which Chap navigates and is able to move through with the move methods - moveChap() etc. It also contains important getters that other modules require, such as the getMaze, timeLeft...

      • Game

            int levelNumber,
            int totalTime,
            int row,
            int col)
        Game constructor.
        Parameters:
        maze - the 2d array of tiles
        levelNumber - what level this is
        totalTime - the total time in the level
        row - the row chap is in
        col - the col chap is in

    • Method Detail

      • loadActors

        public void loadActors()
        Loads the actors into an arraylist at the start of the game. Skips Chap

      • validMove

        public boolean validMove​(Position moveTo)
        Returns a boolean if Chap can move here.

        Checks if the tile allows movement Then checks if it is a door we have the key for Otherwise return false Also assumes that Chap has moved one tile away

        Parameters:
        moveTo - the position to move to
        Returns:
        a boolean if valid

      • moveChap

        public void moveChap​(java.lang.String dir)
        Moves chap in a direction.

        Checks if move is valid and then updates the tiles Performs special actions on special tiles

        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to move (w, a, s, d)

      • updateActors

        public void updateActors()
        Moves all the actors based on their move.

      • chapInValidPos

        public boolean chapInValidPos()
        Checks if chap is currently standing on a valid tile.
        Returns:
        a boolean if chap is on a valid tile

      • pickup

        public void pickup​(Tile moveTo)
        Chap picks up items if there is one on this tile.

        Checks if tile has a key and if so calls addKey Then checks if the tile has treasure and if so removes it IllegalStateException is called if the treasureLeft doesn't match the amount of treasure left

        Parameters:
        moveTo - the tile Chap is picking up items from

      • addKey

        public void addKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Adds a key to Chap's inventory.

        If the key is invalid, or if the keys are full an exception is thrown. If the key is valid, add it to next free space in inventory.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to add

      • removeKey

        public void removeKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Removes a key from inventory.

        Check if we have key and remove first instance Throw IllegalArgumentException if we don't have key

        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove

      • removeChap

        public void removeChap()
        Helper function to quickly remove chap from his current position.
